body.p: This day John Wall appeared before me the undersigned Justice of the Peace, for said county and state, and made oath that on the 12th day of June 1864, that on Patrick Mezher did commit the offence of Grand Larceny, in stealing two horses the property of Benjamin Groomis and on the 12 -- day of June 1864 did sell said horses so stolen to affiant
Sworn to and Subscribed fore me This the 21st of January 1865
G M Soutgate J P for said county

I Edward H East Secretary of the State of Tennessee, do hereby certify that G. M. Southgate whose official signature is attached to the orginal affidavit, now on file in my office am of which the foregoing is a full time and perfect copy, was at the time, the same was, subscribed and sworn to, before, a duly elected commissioned, and acting Justice of the peace, for Davidson county
State of Tennessee, and as such, was empowed to administer oaths, and that the same is entitled to full faith and credit
In Testimony whereof and by order of the Governor I hereunto Subscribe my official signature and affix the Great seal of the State of Tennessee Done at Nashville, January 21st 1865
